description: Egyptian influence carved wood tea caddy (a) with two lidded compartments (b,c) and blue and white ceramic bowl inset (d)
text: This tea caddy was inspired by the heavy neoclassical furniture pictured in the influential design periodical Ackermann’s Repository of Arts. It could well be a miniaturized version of a sideboard that appeared there—a flat-topped piece meant to be placed against a wall, with cupboards and drawers for storing dishes, glasses, and table linen.
title: Tea caddy
